intro: Biscutella angulata, commonly known as the angular biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a small perennial herb with distinctive angular leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant belongs to the family Brassicaceae, also known as the mustard family, and is characterized by its glandular hairs. Biscutella angulata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments. It is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
